item.title: Automated Testing with Chat GPT
item.description: Chat GPT for Automated Testing Introduction: In the realm of automated testing, incorporating advanced technologies like Chat GPT can revolutionize the efficiency and effectiveness of the testing process. With its language generation capabilities and natural language understanding, Chat GPT can bring new dimensions to automated testing, complementing existing tools like Cypress and Selenium.

By delving into this topic, you’ll gain valuable insights into configuring your Docker images and dockerized applications effortlessly.

item.title: Best practice automation websites
item.description: Chat GPT for Automated Testing Practice automation websites In our journey of learning automated tests, it is crucial to have a dedicated system and application for practicing automation without affecting production systems. In this article, I will present a curated list of the top four websites that can be utilized for practicing automated tests without any impact on live production systems.

item.title: How to test Google Analytics with Cypress
item.description: Google Analytics with Cypress What is Google Analytics Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google that tracks and reports website traffic. It is a free tool that helps website owners and marketers understand how visitors interact with their website, including what pages they visit, how long they stay on the site, and what actions they take.

item.title: How to Perform HTTP Requests with Axios
item.description: HTTP Requests with Axiosn What are HTTP requests ? HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a protocol for sending and receiving data over the internet. HTTP requests are messages sent by a client (such as a web browser) to a server to request specific information or resources.

item.title: How to use puppeteer for robotic process automation ?
item.description: Puppeteer for Robotic Process Automation Puppeteer and Nodejs for RPA It is possible to use Node.js, a JavaScript runtime environment, in combination with robotic process automation (RPA) tools to automate tasks and processes. One way to do this is by using an RPA tool that has native support for Node.

item.title: What is robotic process automation ?
item.description: Robotic Process Automation What is robotic process automation ? Robotic process automation (RPA) is a type of technology that allows businesses to automate repetitive, rules-based digital tasks that are typically performed by humans. RPA is typically implemented using software “bots” or “robots” that are programmed to mimic the actions of a human user, such as logging into an application, navigating through a series of screens, and entering data.

item.description: This post (Automating Your Test Runs) is part of a series about Selenium WebDriver with Node.js . You’ll probably get a lot of mileage out of your test suite in its current form if you just run things from your computer, look at the results, and tell people when there are issues.

item.title: How to repeat a command until it fails
item.description: The Problem If you’re working on a test that intermittently fails, it’s useful to have a snippet that will run your test again and again until it fails. This is both to get to the state that it’s failing easier, and to prove that most likely, the bug is fixed (if it doesn’t fail after 5 test runs, chances are it’s no longer an issue).

item.title: The Perfect SEO Optimized Article
item.description: After researching your keywords and writing an article around the subject, use the SEO checklist below to optimize your article: Bold Keyword Italicized Keyword Underlined Keyword a. Make this a hyperlink (www.yourwebsite.com) to another page in your website Insert a picture and make sure its name and ALT tag is the keyword Make the first word in the blog post the keyword Have an H1, H2 and H3 Tag containing the keyword in your article.

item.title: SOLID Principles Simplified with Examples
item.description: SOLID is an acronym created by Michael Feathers from the principles of object-oriented programming identified by Robert C. Martin (Uncle Bob). These principles aim to make the code more readable, easy to maintain, extensible, reusable and without repetition.
